hook.text: When you're sad, you mostly remember sad things. When happy, the world seems full of good memories.

buildup.text: Your current mood acts as a filter, making memories that match it easier to retrieve.

discovery.text: This is mood-congruent memory: emotions serve as retrieval cues that pull up matching experiences.

twist.text: Depression creates a vicious loop‚Äîlow mood retrieves sad memories, which deepen the low mood further.

climax.text: Therapists break the cycle by helping patients access positive memories despite a negative mood state.

punchline.text: Your mood doesn't just color the present. It edits the past.

quiz.question: What is mood-congruent memory?
options: Current mood makes matching memories easier to retrieve
Mood has no effect on memory recall
